text:
A tomb is a place built to bury the dead, usually more elaborate and expensive than a grave. It is often intended to honor the dead, and be visited by the living.
A tomb (from Greek "τύμβος" - tumbos) is generally any structurally enclosed space or chamber used for housing the remains of the dead, and sometimes their possessions. The word is used in a broad sense to encompass a number of such types of places of burial.
